title: Can Anyone Name this Subtlety Rounded Edge Condensed San Serif or Suggest one similar?
content:
Can Anyone Name this Subtlety Rounded Edge Condensed San Serif or Suggest one similar?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807im_/http:/typophile.com/files/thumbNew_3470.php.jpeg)

Font: 

 Trump Gothic Soft 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [thumbNew.php\_.jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807/http:/typophile.com/files/thumbNew.php_.jpeg) | 175.78 KB |
author: csb5374

comments.content:
According to [this post](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fcommercialtype.com/news/updates/new_widths_of_graphik_for_iesquirei_and_ibon_appeacutetiti), Esquire uses (used?) extra condensed weights of [Graphik](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fcommercialtype.com/typefaces/graphik). May be that's the same Graphik Extra Condensed but this time, Rounded.  
Alternatives: [Heroic Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typetrust/heroic-condensed), [Trump Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/trump-gothic-pro) and **[Trump Gothic Soft](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/trump-soft-pro)**, [Cyclone](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/cyclone/overview), [Tungsten](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317064807/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/tungsten/overview) (wrong /R)
Thanks So Much Ryuk! I think Trump Gothic Soft is a suitable alternative.
